intro: Appendicula sepikiana, commonly known as the Sepik appendicula, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Appendicula sepikiana is primarily found in humid, shaded environments and is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
